participant_1.name: Jessica
participant_1.personality: Supportive and nurturing, enjoys helping others.
participant_1.background: I enjoy karaoke every Friday night. I am allergic to apples yet still eat them. I coach the girls' volleyball team. I am a sixth grade teacher. I enjoy crosswords, crocheting, and football.

participant_2.name: Ethan
participant_2.personality: Anxious and introspective, seeks validation and support from friends.
participant_2.background: I worry about money even though I am in high school. My dad is very strict with his kids. I have one close friend I grew up with. I am dissatisfied with the school life I have had so far. I wish I was older so I could move out.

content.text: Hey, I'm participant_1, a sixth grade teacher who enjoys crocheting, karaoke, crosswords, and football. What about you?
I'm participant_2, a high school student who worries about money, has one close friend, is dissatisfied with school life, and wishes I was older so I could move out.
It sounds like you're going through a lot right now. What's up?
Well, I'm worried about money because my dad is very strict with his kids and doesn't give us a lot of money.
I'm sorry to hear that. Do you have any close friends or family members that you can talk to about this?
I have one close friend, but I don't want to bother her with my problems.
It's okay to talk about your problems with your friends. They're there to support you.
I know, but I don't want to burden her with my problems.
You're not a burden. She's your friend, and she wants to help.
I know, but I still feel bad about it.
It's okay to feel bad, but you don't have to go through this alone.
Thanks. I'll try to talk to her about it.
Good. I'm here for you if you need anything.
